185658210.review:
The main issue that i would describe with the game itself is that its design is contradictory. But before that i would like to say that there are elements of the game which are good. 

First the game is free, meaning that you invest nothing but your time. It does have the classic source visuals and the maps are varied and nicely designed. In a vacuum, the guns and characters are nice too. The whiskey as health mechanic is also nice and innovative.

The first and most obvious issue is that the game is barely played. That is not something inherent to the game but it is a fault of its design i do believe. There are currently no more that 100 players average at the times which i play, which means that your gameplay options are limited. This is to be taken into consideration because the only games i was able to play were team deathmatch and deathmatch. If the game in general does not have the following issues, then apologies, sadly there are no other options currently.

The big issue at the core of the game is that its design is contradictory. The game does not know if it wants to be a slow and tactical cowboy era shooter or a mobility shooter+melee. The aiming system making guns acceptably accurate only when standing still and the slow shooting and reloading and small "magazine" sizes for most weapons makes one think that its a tactical shooter where you need to aim well and count your shots when you fight. But the fast mobility when not holding a gun, the absurdly high melee and kick damage, the slide and double jumping and the fact that moving around is the way to stay alive makes one think this is a mobility shooter.

These 2 halves of the game are constantly butting heads with each other which detracts from the gameplay experience. Combined with the big number of max players for a server and a instant respawn for what are comparatively small maps and the average experience turns out to be an absolute clusterf*ck of constantly spawning killing and dying, which creates a gameplay loop which is tiresome. There are moments when you 1v1 and opponent, both taking cover and using skill, aim and deception to kill each other. These are the moments when the game shines. But they are too few and far between the moments when its just a pileup of people constantly spawning and dying over and over. You can kill someone, instantly spawn 20 meter from them, kill them, they spawning 20 meters from you, and then killing you. 

The only way to reliably have fun is for your team to hold up a position in a part of the map and to support each other, but this rarely happens. 95% of the time you will be alone and considering the lack of crowd control weapons, partially except the pump shotgun, and the slow respawn rate of whiskey makes a solo game a constant spawn, kill one enemy, another random enemy kills you because you were reloading or they just spawned 10 meters from you, respawn, repeat. This chaotic nature of the game also kinda makes the chest guns mostly useless, because while they are better than starting weapons, they are not that better to help you in fighting more than one enemy, and most of the time they disappear when you die, so you cant get em back.

Also horses are insta-kill machines. A shotgun blast to the chest does not kill a man but a horse running at them at 30 km/h just dissolves their organs for some reason.

In the end one can try this game just for curiosity, like i did. But considering that it is practically at the end of its life and it is poorly designed, you would not miss much by not playing it.

185298628.review:
Quite an interesting and fun game to play with your friends. An unique playstyle and game mechanics set this one apart from your typical shooter:

-Ammo is infinite but slow reloads mean you better use it wisely
-Choose your own weapon: more challenging the kill, the higher are the rewards so picking the strongest weapon does not directly make you the best player
-Keeping the streak up: bigger kill streaks add a multiplyer to your points, hence suicidal attacks are not always the best way to go

Gameplay-wise, the game offers quite a bit of variety with its several maps, weapons and thanks to the things that I mentioned before, is quite balanced overall. In fact, the most OP thing I have encountered are the expert bots in singleplayer. The controls might take a little to get used to but that shouldn't be anything unheard of. In the end of the day, it is not a hardcore shooter but more of a fun alternative to enjoy with your friends for a change. I approve!

183836111.review: Fistful of Frags - I can't think of a better Arena shooter. From the Western atmosphere to the fun gunplay, this game has a lot of charm. The developer, Rebel Yell, has been MIA for awhile so even though this game has potential I feel like at the moment it is being lost. Then again it's an older source mod, maybe some other title can remake things and outdo it as a spirtual successor. Until then this game, nostalgia and all, is still pretty great and free. Try it out!
